intro: Leucocarpum obscurum, commonly known as the dark leucocarpum, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Leucocarpum obscurum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and resilience in warm climates.
